Significant Battles

Original Name: Ali Gauhar.
His reign was long and eventful.
Third Battle of Panipat (1761): Between the Marathas and Abdali.
Battle of Buxar (1764): The combined forces of Shah Alam II, Mir Qasim (Bengal), and Shuja-ud-Daula (Awadh) were defeated by the British (Hector Munro).
Treaty of Allahabad (1765): Under this, he granted the 'Diwani' (revenue rights) of Bengal, Bihar, and Orissa to the British and became their pensioner (first pensioner Mughal).

ЁЯПЫя╕П
Maratha Patronage

In 1772, Mahadji Scindia (Maratha) reinstated him on the throne of Delhi. In 1803, the British captured Delhi and confined the Mughal emperor to the Red Fort only.
